item.title: From EIGENSTRAT to PACKEDPED
item.description:
The files downloaded in the previous blog post are in EIGENSTRAT format. In this post, weâ€™ll look at how to convert them to PACKEDPED format.

PACKEDPED format allows for easier downstream processing using the PLINK toolset. With PLINK, it becomes straightforward to extract sample subsets, filter SNPs, and perform a wide range of analyses.

Downloading PLINK

I use PLINK 1.9. While there is a newer version (2.0), I prefer 1.9 because it includes several features that were deprecated or removed in the newer release.

item.title: Getting Started with Population Genetic Analysis
item.description:
A Linux environment is unavoidable when it comes to bioinformatical data processing and preparation. You can use your favorite distribution.

For Windows users, the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) provides a good alternative to dual booting or setting up a full virtual machine.

Installing WSL with Debian

Open PowerShell as Administrator and run:

wsl --install -d Debian

Once installed, update the system:

sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y

Downloading A Genetic Dataset

Next, you need to obtain a genetic dataset. A good and comprehensive resource is the Allen Ancient DNA Resource (AADR).
